dcterms:creator: Karl Friston
Spyridon Samothrakis
Read Montague
dcterms:description: The Mountain Car problem is a reinforcement learning task where an agent must drive a car up a hill by managing its momentum, starting from a random position with only noisy position observations.
dcterms:title: Mountain Car problem

dcterms:creator: Cedric De Boom
Tim Verbelen
Bart Dhoedt
dcterms:description: The preferred state distribution is based on expert demonstrations, providing a Gaussian distribution centered around the state visited by an expert to guide the agent's behavior.
dcterms:title: Preferred state distribution (based on expert demonstration)

dcterms:creator: Ozan Catal
Johannes Nauta
Tim Verbelen
Pieter Simoens
Bart Dhoedt
dcterms:description: Active inference models refer to various models used in the context of Bayesian policy selection, focusing on how agents can select optimal policies based on active inference principles.
dcterms:title: Active inference models

dcterms:creator: Kai Ueltzh√∂ffer
dcterms:description: Deep active inference models utilize deep learning techniques to implement active inference, allowing for complex decision-making processes in uncertain environments.
dcterms:title: Deep active inference models

dcterms:creator: Beren Millidge
dcterms:description: Variational policy gradients are a method in deep active inference that combines variational inference with policy gradient methods to optimize decision-making in uncertain environments.
dcterms:title: Variational policy gradients
